docs.snippet: A professor tries to unearth biases to aid criminal justice....
docs.lead_paragraph: A professor tries to unearth biases to aid criminal justice.
docs.abstract: Interview with Prof Jennifer L Eberhardt, associate professor of psychology at Stanford University, who has won 2014 MacArthur 'genius' grant for her research into effect of unconscious ideas about race on workings of the criminal justice system.

headline.seo: A MacArthur Grant Winner Tries to Unearth Biases to Aid Criminal Justice
headline.main: Perceptions of Race at a Glance
headline.kicker: A Conversation With Jennifer L. Eberhardt
headline.print_headline: Perceptions of Race at a Glance

docs.snippet: After two weeks of cautious, sometimes halting remarks, Mayor Bill de Blasio blasted the language of police unions and those who turned their backs on him at two officers’ funerals....
docs.lead_paragraph: After two weeks of cautious, sometimes halting remarks, Mayor Bill de Blasio blasted the language of police unions and those who turned their backs on him at two officers’ funerals.
docs.abstract: Feistier side of New York Mayor Bill de Blasio emerges as he proves he is not intimidated by rift with Police Department that is turning into serious issue for his administration; blasts law-enforcement unions for suggesting deaths of two officers was City Hall's fault.

headline.main: Feistier de Blasio Appears, Uncowed by Police Unions
headline.print_headline: Feistier de Blasio Appears, Uncowed by Police Unions

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama pledged to stand with Mexico against "the scourge of violence and the drug cartels" as he met Tuesday with President Enrique Pena Nieto amid concern over the unsolved abduction of 43 Mexican college students last September....
